name: Richard W. MORGAN, III, v. Lynne M. PEARCE, Harold S. Campbell and Charles E. Messics. Appeal of Harold S. CAMPBELL

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and STOUT, JJ.
STOUT, former J., did not participate in the decision of this matter.
parties: Richard W. MORGAN, III, v. Lynne M. PEARCE, Harold S. Campbell and Charles E. Messics. Appeal of Harold S. CAMPBELL.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
STOUT, former J., did not participate in the decision of this matter.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Richard A. Sprague, J. Shane Creamer, Randi J. Vladimer, Philadelphia, for Harold S. Campbell.
George A. Heitczman, Vivian M. Appel, Bethlehem, for Richard Morgan.
Ronald W. Shipman, Easton, for Lynne M. Pearce.
Philip D. Lauer, Easton, for Charles E. Messics.
casebody.head_matter:
560 A.2d 128
Richard W. MORGAN, III, v. Lynne M. PEARCE, Harold S. Campbell and Charles E. Messics. Appeal of Harold S. CAMPBELL.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dec. 7, 1988.
Decided June 1, 1989.
Richard A. Sprague, J. Shane Creamer, Randi J. Vladimer, Philadelphia, for Harold S. Campbell.
George A. Heitczman, Vivian M. Appel, Bethlehem, for Richard Morgan.
Ronald W. Shipman, Easton, for Lynne M. Pearce.
Philip D. Lauer, Easton, for Charles E. Messics.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and STOUT, JJ.
